response.answer_text: Yes, it is very good but I'm little disappointed by battery. See OnePlus Nord has been launched in India and is being touted as a part of the company's “affordable smartphone product line”. The device is available in three distinct configurations, and the company claims delivers a flagship camera experience. The OnePlus Nord has a hole-punch display design and flaunts quad rear cameras same as the OnePlus 8.  The OnePlus Nord has a 6.44-inch Full HD+ AMOLED display with 90Hz refresh rate and a punch hole. Powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 765G processor and supports 5G connectivity. The phone is available in three RAM/Storage options including 6GB / 64GB, 8GB/128GB storage, and 12GB/256GB storage. In terms of optics the smartphone has a quad rear camera setup which includes a 48 MP primary sensor, a second 8 MP camera, a 5MP sensor and a fourth 2MP sensor. It also has a dual front camera 32 MP + 8 MP sensor. It is backed by a 4,115mAh battery with 30T fast charging and runs on the company’s proprietary OxygenOS based on Android 10.  Design The phone features a 6.44-inch full-HD+ Fluid AMOLED display with 90Hz refresh rate, 1,080 x 2,400 pixels resolution and a 20:9 aspect ratio. The phone comes with Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection and supports features including Reading Mode, Night Mode, and Video Enhancer. It measures 158.3x73.3x8.2mm and weighs 184 grams. It is available in two colour options, Marble and Gray Onyx. Camera OnePlus Nord 5G packs a quad rear camera which includes a 48 MP Sony IMX586 primary sensor with an f/1.75 lens. The primary sensor is the same as the OnePlus 8, and it comes along with optical image stabilisation (OIS). The camera has an 8 MP secondary sensor with an f/2.25 ultra-wide-angle with a field of view (FoV) of 119 degrees. It has a 2 MP macro shooter and a 5 MP depth shooter with an f/2.4 aperture. Performance  The OnePlus Nord runs on Android 10-based OxygenOS 10.5 OS. It Is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 765G chipset with up to 12 GB of RAM. It has an octa-core (1x2.4 GHz Kryo 475 Prime & 1x2.2 GHz Kryo 475 Gold & 6x1.8 GHz Kryo 475 Silver) processor and Adreno 620 GPU. Sensors included in the smartphone are an accelerometer, ambient light sensor, gyroscope, a magnetometer, and a proximity sensor. It comes with an in-display fingerprint sensor for additional security. Battery and Storage The OnePlus Nord 5G is backed by a 4,115mAh battery with support for Warp Charge 30T fast charging technology. The company claims that the phone can be charged up to 70% in just 30 minutes. OnePlus Nord 5G is available in up to 256GB of UFS 2.1 storage that it non-expandable.  Configuration On the storage front, the OnePlus Nord 5G is available in up to 256GB of UFS 2.1 storage that doesn't support expansion via a microSD card slot. The phone runs on Android 10-based OxygenOS 10.5 OS and is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 765G chipset with up to 12 GB of RAM. Connectivity Connectivity options included in the smartphone are 5G, 4G LTE, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth v5.1, NFC, GPS/ A-GPS/ NavIC, and a USB Type-C port. The phone also supports Dual sim with dual standby.
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Sai Sri Mourya Pusuluri

response.answer_text: Yes,oneplus nord is best smartphone that u got in this segment its 720g processor is amazing and dual front camera and quad camera rear setup overall performance and feature is great but the only cons. Is it does not have headphone Jack, the rear depth and wide camera should be more and does not support reverse charging and microsd issue keeping all these aside if looking for a worthy phone you can go for it as its the first phone that first oneplus launched in such price range. If i tell u my experience i firstly choose oneplus 8 but after this i changed my decision and ordered 1marvel blue for my father Thanks
